intro: Sisymbrium heteromallum f. glabrum, commonly known as the smooth field pennycress, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops such as mustard and cabbage. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring simple, alternate leaves that are ovate to lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are small, yellow, and clustered in racemes, and it produces slender, elongated pods that contain several seeds. The plant is often found in disturbed soils and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural fields.
